From a purely financial point of view it is cheaper and easier to go to the local community college. Credits are cheaper and as long as you don't need to pay rent your living expenses will also be lower. After 2 years you can transfer out to another school. The community college is a great way to get basic classes out of the way for any major cheaper. You might also determine that mechanical engineering isn't something you want to do after taking some basic classes. I changed my major twice in undergrad. Don't let the no friends part be a factor. You'll make friends in college. At the same time going away for school can have a lot of benefits. It helps make you an adult and having to take care of yourself - which I'm sure is not a problem for you in anyway. The scholarship is a huge bonus and it isn't that far away (I'm guessing 1:30-2 hour drive). The costs will be higher though and I'm sure that you will need to take out more loans than expected. It is also possible that you might dislike the school or your major and once there is it more difficult to change your path. I think that it is possible your parents cannot help you in a few years and are really looking out to try to prevent you from going too much into debt. Their attempt to push you toward community college might be because they're worried that the $25k isn't going to be there. In the end though I think it comes down to two choices: 1) Stay local, do basic classes, keep things on the cheap end, and transfer out. 2) Go to your 1st choice, take whatever they can give you (the school), and loan the rest for the remainder of college without worrying about any support from your parents. If you want to take the hit in the wallet, there are programs such as income based repayment which could be a must for all loans you take. I'm still in debt from grad school and I do not see anyway I will ever pay it off. From my experiences I would say keep it cheap as possible especially if you want to continue your education post-undergrad. Just make sure to transfer out after 2 years because the school has a huge impact on job/post-grad prospects.

I stopped playing both those games. Frontline got too boring and I wasn #8217;t getting better. Langrisser was too much work to do everything in it. Also the difficulty jump made it difficult (since it kept up with you) to actually be able to feel like I was making progress and I felt like my resources were getting thinned out.

You can check frontline once a day or so and get some stuff out of it and use your friends to help do a lot of the battles. Plus you can do well even with weaker units based on synergy or overall numbers (like using 3 stars over 5 stars units). Langrassier I think I hit level 22 or higher and I couldn #8217;t use my good units all the time because they #8217;re weak to enemy units and the weaker units don #8217;t hold up as well even with advantage. I also felt I had to check it every 4-8 hours to really get it. I #8217;m so disappointed about MOE ending.

WRITING.TITLE: Unable to find a job for almost a year
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;ve been mostly unemployed for the last year with applying to jobs often, one interview, and tons of rejections. Here #8217;s the kicker - I have a jd, I #8217;m a licensed attorney, and I even have a masters in management. I have experience as an attorney doing compliance work and litigation support. I even worked for Walmart for a short period of time. Yet I #8217;m getting no where. I just want that 9-5 job and there are tons of companies near me (in and around Philly). It #8217;s starting to get very concerning.
Alabama explains a lot

I #8217;ve used staffing agencies and project companies. Many of them don #8217;t have anything. The rest don #8217;t seem to do anything. I #8217;m so disappointed about that. Most of the jobs I apply to went legal experience and most of mine comes from being an attorney. Otherwise I have no real work history.
Thanks I #8217;ll try to post there and see what #8217;s wrong.

While a lot of the jobs don #8217;t require a jd my experience is mostly relating to being an attorney. My concern is if they see I #8217;ve done litigation work or work for a company but not have the education to do it or what appears to be actual legal experience I #8217;m worried it #8217;ll be the same as it is now. I have a skill set that includes more than just legal stuff since I know coding and office programs. I also was a notary (it expired), certified in mediation, and have a masters in sports management. I would love to get into that field.

I went to law school out of state and the attorneys I know in pa are not hiring people. Even friends if the family who are attorneys haven #8217;t offered me anything. My uncle did set up an interview but I don #8217;t think they were hiring and now they #8217;ve been out of business for like five plus years. I think at this point I #8217;m just happy to do legal related work for a company and not chase that partnership track firm job.
Someone suggested to send it over to the resume sub so I think I #8217;ll do that and see if it can be improved.

I hear that a thousand times over. I have a bachelors, my jd, and a masters. I have friends who have degrees (either useful ones or several degrees) and can #8217;t find something. I feel you pain as do several people I know.

Ideally I would like a job in that field or in a legal department (9-5 type). https://docdro.id/cFkk3gu I do not usually use a cover letter.

Lately I #8217;ve been tired of tv dramas. I know it #8217;s not a movie but it started to bother me in some shows where they act all dramatic that somethings going to happen to a major character, but it #8217;s episode 5 in the season. Nothings going to happen? Cliffhanger? Already renewed for next season so they #8217;ll be fine. That #8217;s actually why I stopped watching Castle.

From the shows perspective it feels lazy and rushed. I believe that she didn #8217;t need to go above and beyond by burning the city and almost everyone in it, but I believe she did it for a reason. I think she burned it down because of what it represented: a old male dominated system of subjugating the kingdoms and lords to a single lord - something she fought against believing people should be free. She didn #8217;t need to, but I would like to think that to her it makes sense. Destroy it all. Don #8217;t let it be there. Don #8217;t rule from it as it is. She has been abused, lied to, and fought for everything. If we have anyone to blame it #8217;s really the writers for forcing it over letting it just happen. Could she have stopped? Yes. Should she have stopped? Probably. But overall I would be pissed, too. The person she loves she can #8217;t love and has a better claim than she does even if he doesn #8217;t want it. She lost two dragons. A lot of her men fought in the north without many thanks. She wanted support and everyone around her was either killed, betrayed her, or was plotting/lying to her. While it was rushed and a bit lazy, I can #8217;t help but feel that she did what made sense to her and you think those people would support her out of love or just fear and she #8217;ll be just like everyone else so her going mad makes more sense if you believe that she did it thinking that it #8217;s symbolic destroying the city is breaking the chains/wheel/circle or she did it to get the fear aspect done first with the forgiveness loving leader later.

People will believe something is wrong when it directly impacts them usually financially. Those government checks stop coming? You lose your job because the company got a billion dollar tax refund and laid you off? You can #8217;t get six anymore because of the shut down? Experiences change people. Not words. Not facts. As long as it fits their narrow viewpoint they don #8217;t care. When it hits them in the wallet then they understand.

My daughter (3) asked me where my grandfather was. He had passed away over 20 years ago from diabetes. I had no idea how to answer that so I said he was sick. She got upset so I said oh don #8217;t worry he #8217;s better now. Not only was it upsetting to her (especially because my dad was in and out of the hospital for a bit after having a heart attack this year and we said he was #8220;sick #8221;), but it also made me upset because I couldn #8217;t convey what happened and because it made me miss my grandparents.

Upgrading to first class on flights during bad weather seasons. We were flying to Florida from philly in February and a massive snow storm hit. We were stuck on the plane for three hours before we got off until they could de-ice the plane again and get it ready to fly during a break in the storm. We got right back on the plane and waited again before finally getting out. Last flight out as well. Ive never been so happy that our 3+ hour flight delay was when we had upgraded seats and were comfortable during the delay. Few other flying upgrades that are totally worth it: Boise cancelling headphones and getting tsa precheck/global entry. Global entry is fantastic if you do any traveling outside the us (granted not every country/us airport has it but it #8217;s worth it). Some of my friends also use travel credit cards to get access to lounges while traveling.

WRITING.TITLE: Grading signed artist proofs
WRITING.TEXT: Would it be worth it to get signed artist proofs graded? I have at least two (spikeshot goblin and read the runes) that, since they are not playable, might be better graded than in a binder. Alan pollack was at one of the events in philly years ago so I purchased the cards directly from him and saw him sign them so they are legitimate, but would it add any value or make them more collectible graded?
That #8217;s what I was thinking. The cards aren #8217;t ultra expensive or game breaking so I wasn #8217;t sure how much the price would actually be impacted with being graded/certified. Thank you.
Is that true? That #8217;s insane.
What about a sealed pack of antiquities?
My favorite is that they took the worthless brown diamonds and market them as unique #8220;chocolate #8221; diamonds. It #8217;s all a racket.
It always seems like people on fb groups will take the low price and undercut it by around 10%. It definitely feels like a direct way to try to blow them out if you can tolerate the process.

The older cards, maybe due to smaller print runs, collectability, age, whatever, holds their value a bit more. I wouldn #8217;t be surprised to see the price drop a bit but not by much and eventually go back up.

I feel the same way sometimes. I don #8217;t get to play often but that doesn #8217;t stop me from buying new sets or singles or older cards to decks. I hope it #8217;ll make me happy when I get them but I don #8217;t know if it does. You #8217;re not alone. While I am not encouraging you to buy cards you shouldn #8217;t have fomo over them, consider them to be more like stocks while if you buy high the retune isn #8217;t there so you want to make smart purchases. A lot of people Speculate on cards, you just need to make the purchases smart. If you can reduce your spending to speculation of cheaper cards you might be able to avoid buying expensive cards and eventually you #8217;ll either start to sell what you have to make a profit or you #8217;ll tap out. I also do suggest seeking help. Therapy has done a lot for me as has seeing a psychiatrist.
I #8217;ve seen a lot of jump start misprints so I #8217;m guessing quality control doesn #8217;t exist anymore. It #8217;s all about pumping out new products every month.

You are totally right. It seems like the jumpstart cards aren #8217;t very good quality wise. Some say they can see a quality difference between cards made in North America and overseas (mostly japan). The Japanese cards, apparently, have better card stock and quality/clarity. Maybe they #8217;re having printer issues in Canada (I think that #8217;s where they #8217;re printing them?). Maybe they #8217;re rushing it. Maybe they just don #8217;t care.

I like that they tried but they #8217;re reprinted those cards to the point that I don #8217;t think they #8217;re special anymore. I liked opening a few boxes and getting one, but the cards are also worthless from the sets. With the number of new sets coming out and the chase cards in them I think wotc found out that but making more sets with powerful reprints every month makes more money than a few special cards every three months.

I #8217;m actually in favor of buying Italian cards or other cards in different languages. I don #8217;t want to pay 80 for a card that I can get for 18. Sooner or later those cheap Italian cards dry up and go up in value. I don #8217;t mind sitting on them or playing with them.

Had to luck into it. Now there is so much supporting the game and celebs playing. It went from playing overnight or once a month and I don #8217;t want to be judged for playing it to mainstream cool.

It #8217;s at the point that you either buy packs to chase those high end foils if any or just buy singles. If anything it #8217;s put a strain on getting reserve list cards and older foils since they #8217;re not as common.

Some people are saying that they want and prefer the idea of a set box over regular packs. The regular packs are for drafting or limited formats but the set boxes are supposed to be for the chase card collectors/people who open packs for fun/set collectors. Costs more but it #8217;s supposed to eb freezer repeat cards and be the same amount of rares and foils. It #8217;s basically now there are at least three products per set

I purchased one based on the fact I suspect it to not be purchased like the ooze ones (I got two of them). I also don #8217;t like the idea of reprinting the same cards with different names which will cause these to increase in necessity (like portal 3 kingdoms). And I #8217;m the type of person who is okay using proxies and foreign cards in decks and even wanted Chinese proxies to do a cube. I can only hope that future ip crossovers will be silver boarder or not happen at all. I don #8217;t think my single purchase is enough to sway wotc in either direction.
